segment.source: How to test a driver at runtime from a Command Prompt
segment.target: How to test a driver at runtime from a Command Prompt

segment.source: The WDK provides device testing components that enable you to test a driver on a test computer on your network.
segment.target: The WDK provides device testing components that enable you to test a driver on a test computer on your network.

segment.source: You can use these components outside of Visual Studio by copying and installing the necessary files.
segment.target: You can use these components outside of Visual Studio by copying and installing the necessary files.

segment.source: You can use these components to run the same collection of device driver tests that are available in Visual Studio to test the features and functions of your driver.
segment.target: You can use these components to run the same collection of device driver tests that are available in Visual Studio to test the features and functions of your driver.

segment.source: Starting in WDK 8.1, you can copy and run the HCK Test Suites on test computers using command scripts.
segment.target: Starting in WDK 8.1, you can copy and run the HCK Test Suites on test computers using command scripts.

segment.source: See How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1.
segment.target: See How to run the HCK Test Suites in WDK 8.1.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Install Visual Studio and the WDK on the computer you use for development.
segment.target: Install Visual Studio and the WDK on the computer you use for development.

segment.source: From Visual Studio, you can configure and provision computers for testing.
segment.target: From Visual Studio, you can configure and provision computers for testing.

segment.source: When you configure the test computer, the WDK driver test framework automatically enables the test computer for remote debugging and transfers the necessary test binaries and support files.
segment.target: When you configure the test computer, the WDK driver test framework automatically enables the test computer for remote debugging and transfers the necessary test binaries and support files.

segment.source: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions in Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)
segment.target: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions in Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1)

segment.source: Although it is not recommended, you can also install the necessary test components manually.
segment.target: Although it is not recommended, you can also install the necessary test components manually.

segment.source: Follow the instructions to install the Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) and WDTF on the test computer.
segment.target: Follow the instructions to install the Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) and WDTF on the test computer.

segment.source: See Manually installing and uninstalling TAEF on a test computer and Manually installing WDTF on a test computer.
segment.target: See Manually installing and uninstalling TAEF on a test computer and Manually installing WDTF on a test computer.

segment.source: Instructions
segment.target: Instructions

segment.source: Step 1: Copy the tests to the test computer
segment.target: Step 1: Copy the tests to the test computer

segment.source: Copy the Device Fundamentals Tests from the computer you use for development.
segment.target: Copy the Device Fundamentals Tests from the computer you use for development.

segment.source: Copy the folder %ProgramFiles%\\Windows Kits\\8.0\\Testing\\Tests\\Device Fundamentals to the test computer.
segment.target: Copy the folder %ProgramFiles%\\Windows Kits\\8.0\\Testing\\Tests\\Device Fundamentals to the test computer.

segment.source: Step 2: Run the tests
segment.target: Step 2: Run the tests

segment.source: The TAEF command to run the tests uses the following syntax:
segment.target: The TAEF command to run the tests uses the following syntax:

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: You must specify the test binary (.dll) or script (.wsc) file.
segment.target: You must specify the test binary (.dll) or script (.wsc) file.

segment.source: The test method (/name:<test method>) is optional.
segment.target: The test method (/name:<test method>) is optional.

segment.source: For the test names and test methods, see the Device Fundamentals Tests.
segment.target: For the test names and test methods, see the Device Fundamentals Tests.

segment.source: For information about specifying test parameters, see Device Fundamentals Test Parameters and Te.exe Command Options .
segment.target: For information about specifying test parameters, see Device Fundamentals Test Parameters and Te.exe Command Options .

segment.source: For example, to run all PnP tests in the Devfund\_PnPDTest.dll on a device with a specific device ID.
segment.target: For example, to run all PnP tests in the Devfund\_PnPDTest.dll on a device with a specific device ID.

segment.source: For example, to run PnP Surprise Remove test on a device with a specific device ID.
segment.target: For example, to run PnP Surprise Remove test on a device with a specific device ID.
